parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From sun and phero; to bear together, i.e. to collect, or to conduce; especially advantage.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From epi and ballo; to throw upon; specially to reflect; impersonally, to belong to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
From eu and schema; well-formed, i.e. decorous, noble.
Adverb from a compound of a and a presumed derivative of perispao; undistractedly, i.e. Free from solicitude.
Constantly attending to, devoted. From eu and the same as prosedreuo; sitting well towards, i.e. assiduous.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
